elements.text: create a trail account in livehelpnow

messages.text:
<@U37KPJ30D>,
I created a trial account in LiveHelpNow and tested its Salesforce integration. Below are the steps I followed and the final outcome:
Steps performed:
1. Created a Salesforce Developer Edition org.
2. Created a dedicated integration user and generated a security token.
3. Created a LiveHelpNow trial account.
4. Navigated to Settings → Integrations → Salesforce in LiveHelpNow.
5. Authorized Salesforce using OAuth (Authorize with Live).
6. Enabled:
Enable Salesforce Integration
Create a Case per Chat / Offline Message
7. Configured field mappings (Subject, Description, Origin).
8. Tested both Chat and Offline Message scenarios.
9. Verified Salesforce permissions by manually creating a Case using the integration user.

*Final outcome / Issue:*
Authorization and field mapping configuration completed successfully.
However, no Case records were created in Salesforce from LiveHelpNow chats or offline messages.
• Salesforce debug logs show no inbound API calls from LiveHelpNow, which confirms Salesforce is not receiving any Case creation request.
• Manual Case creation works, so Salesforce is not the blocker.
*Conclusion:*
LiveHelpNow supports Salesforce integration by design (OAuth + Case mapping UI), but in the trial environment the runtime Case creation is not triggered. This indicates that the Salesforce connector likely requires vendor-side enablement or a licensed plan to activate.
*Please confirm:*
• Whether Salesforce integration is enabled for our LiveHelpNow plan, and
• If any additional vendor-side configuration is required to activate Case creation.

elements.text:
,
I created a trial account in LiveHelpNow and tested its Salesforce integration. Below are the steps I followed and the final outcome:
Steps performed:
1. Created a Salesforce Developer Edition org.
2. Created a dedicated integration user and generated a security token.
3. Created a LiveHelpNow trial account.
4. Navigated to Settings → Integrations → Salesforce in LiveHelpNow.
5. Authorized Salesforce using OAuth (Authorize with Live).
6. Enabled:
Enable Salesforce Integration
Create a Case per Chat / Offline Message
7. Configured field mappings (Subject, Description, Origin).
8. Tested both Chat and Offline Message scenarios.
9. Verified Salesforce permissions by manually creating a Case using the integration user.
Final outcome / Issue:

Authorization and field mapping configuration completed successfully.
However, no Case records were created in Salesforce from LiveHelpNow chats or offline messages.
Salesforce debug logs show no inbound API calls from LiveHelpNow, which confirms Salesforce is not receiving any Case creation request.
Manual Case creation works, so Salesforce is not the blocker.
Conclusion:

LiveHelpNow supports Salesforce integration by design (OAuth + Case mapping UI), but in the trial environment the runtime Case creation is not triggered. This indicates that the Salesforce connector likely requires vendor-side enablement or a licensed plan to activate.
Please confirm:
Whether Salesforce integration is enabled for our LiveHelpNow plan, and
If any additional vendor-side configuration is required to activate Case creation.

messages.text:
<@U37KPJ30D> found  when LiveChatNow creates a Case, it is identified by Case Origin = Chat and Type = Question. livehelpnow only populates basic Case fields like Subject, Description, SuppliedName, and SuppliedEmail. After the Case is created, Salesforce runs the “*Case Created Add Contact*” Flow, which calls the Apex class *CreateContactForCaseHelper*. This Apex class creates a new Contact using the visitor’s name and email and assigns it to the Account named “ARA Customer Care”, then updates the Case to link both the Contact and the Account.

and also found few users who has permission set assigned.Updated in sheet.

elements.text: found  when LiveChatNow creates a Case, it is identified by Case Origin = Chat and Type = Question. livehelpnow only populates basic Case fields like Subject, Description, SuppliedName, and SuppliedEmail. After the Case is created, Salesforce runs the “
Case Created Add Contact
” Flow, which calls the Apex class
CreateContactForCaseHelper

. This Apex class creates a new Contact using the visitor’s name and email and assigns it to the Account named “ARA Customer Care”, then updates the Case to link both the Contact and the Account.

and also found few users who has permission set assigned.Updated in sheet.
